intro: Echites difformis, commonly known as the variable echites, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
